operations.summary: List all active channels in Asterisk.

operations.notes: The new channel is created immediately and a snapshot of it returned. If a Stasis application is provided it will be automatically subscribed to the originated channel for further events and updates.

parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: Endpoint to call.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: The extension to dial after the endpoint answers

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context to dial after the endpoint answers. If omitted, uses 'default'

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: The priority to dial after the endpoint answers. If omitted, uses 1

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: The application that is subscribed to the originated channel, and passed to the Stasis application.

parameters.name: appArgs
parameters.description: The application arguments to pass to the Stasis application.

parameters.name: callerId
parameters.description: CallerID to use when dialing the endpoint or extension.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Timeout (in seconds) before giving up dialing, or -1 for no timeout.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description: The "variables" key in the body object holds variable key/value pairs to set on the channel on creation. Other keys in the body object are interpreted as query parameters. Ex. { "endpoint": "SIP/Alice", "variables": { "CALLERID(name)": "Alice" } }

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: The unique id to assign the channel on creation.

parameters.name: otherChannelId
parameters.description: The unique id to assign the second channel when using local channels.

parameters.name: originator
parameters.description: The unique id of the channel which is originating this one.

errorResponses.reason: Invalid parameters for originating a channel.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel's id

operations.summary: Create a new channel (originate with id).
operations.notes: The new channel is created immediately and a snapshot of it returned. If a Stasis application is provided it will be automatically subscribed to the originated channel for further events and updates.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: The unique id to assign the channel on creation.

parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: Endpoint to call.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: The extension to dial after the endpoint answers

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context to dial after the endpoint answers. If omitted, uses 'default'

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: The priority to dial after the endpoint answers. If omitted, uses 1

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: The application that is subscribed to the originated channel, and passed to the Stasis application.

parameters.name: appArgs
parameters.description: The application arguments to pass to the Stasis application.

parameters.name: callerId
parameters.description: CallerID to use when dialing the endpoint or extension.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Timeout (in seconds) before giving up dialing, or -1 for no timeout.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description: The "variables" key in the body object holds variable key/value pairs to set on the channel on creation. Other keys in the body object are interpreted as query parameters. Ex. { "endpoint": "SIP/Alice", "variables": { "CALLERID(name)": "Alice" } }

parameters.name: otherChannelId
parameters.description: The unique id to assign the second channel when using local channels.

parameters.name: originator
parameters.description: The unique id of the channel which is originating this one.

errorResponses.reason: Invalid parameters for originating a channel.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel's id

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Reason for hanging up the channel

apis.description: Exit application; continue execution in the dialplan

operations.summary: Exit application; continue execution in the dialplan.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel's id

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context to continue to.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: The extension to continue to.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: The priority to continue to.

operations.summary: Send provided DTMF to a given channel.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel's id

parameters.name: dtmf
parameters.description: DTMF To send.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Amount of time to wait before DTMF digits (specified in milliseconds) start.

parameters.name: between
parameters.description: Amount of time in between DTMF digits (specified in milliseconds).

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Length of each DTMF digit (specified in milliseconds).

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Amount of time to wait after DTMF digits (specified in milliseconds) end.

parameters.description: Direction in which to mute audio

apis.description: Play music on hold to a channel

operations.summary: Play music on hold to a channel.
operations.notes: Using media operations such as /play on a channel playing MOH in this manner will suspend MOH without resuming automatically. If continuing music on hold is desired, the stasis application must reinitiate music on hold.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel's id

parameters.name: mohClass
parameters.description: Music on hold class to use

errorResponses.reason: Channel not in a Stasis application

operations.summary: Stop playing music on hold to a channel.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel's id

errorResponses.reason: Channel not in a Stasis application

operations.notes: Using media operations such as /play on a channel playing silence in this manner will suspend silence without resuming automatically.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel's id

errorResponses.reason: Channel not in a Stasis application

operations.summary: Stop playing silence to a channel.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel's id

errorResponses.reason: Channel not in a Stasis application

operations.notes: The media URI may be any of a number of URI's. Currently sound:, recording:, number:, digits:, characters:, and tone: URI's are supported. This operation creates a playback resource that can be used to control the playback of media (pause, rewind, fast forward, etc.)

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel's id

parameters.name: media
parameters.description: Media's URI to play.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: For sounds, selects language for sound.

parameters.name: offsetms
parameters.description: Number of media to skip before playing.

parameters.name: skipms
parameters.description: Number of milliseconds to skip for forward/reverse operations.

parameters.name: playbackId
parameters.description: Playback ID.

errorResponses.reason: Channel not in a Stasis application

operations.summary: Start playback of media and specify the playbackId.
operations.notes: The media URI may be any of a number of URI's. Currently sound: and recording: URI's are supported. This operation creates a playback resource that can be used to control the playback of media (pause, rewind, fast forward, etc.)

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel's id

parameters.name: playbackId
parameters.description: Playback ID.

parameters.name: media
parameters.description: Media's URI to play.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: For sounds, selects language for sound.

parameters.name: offsetms
parameters.description: Number of media to skip before playing.

parameters.name: skipms
parameters.description: Number of milliseconds to skip for forward/reverse operations.

errorResponses.reason: Channel not in a Stasis application

operations.notes: Record audio from a channel. Note that this will not capture audio sent to the channel. The bridge itself has a record feature if that's what you want.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel's id

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Recording's filename

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format to encode audio in

parameters.name: maxDurationSeconds
parameters.description: Maximum duration of the recording, in seconds. 0 for no limit

parameters.name: maxSilenceSeconds
parameters.description: Maximum duration of silence, in seconds. 0 for no limit

parameters.name: ifExists
parameters.description: Action to take if a recording with the same name already exists.

parameters.name: beep
parameters.description: Play beep when recording begins

parameters.name: terminateOn
parameters.description: DTMF input to terminate recording

errorResponses.reason: Channel is not in a Stasis application; the channel is currently bridged with other hcannels; A recording with the same name already exists on the system and can not be overwritten because it is in progress or ifExists=fail
The format specified is unknown on this system

parameters.name: variable
parameters.description: The channel variable or function to get

parameters.name: variable
parameters.description: The channel variable or function to set

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set the variable to

Channel.description: A specific communication connection between Asterisk and an Endpoint.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the channel.

This is the same as the Uniqueid field in AMI.
